Class LineInputHandler

java.lang.Object
parade.helpers.inputHandlers.InputHandler
parade.helpers.inputHandlers.LineInputHandler
public class LineInputHandler extends InputHandler
Handles line-based input from the terminal using JLine. Allows players to type input directly via keyboard during their turn.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type

    JLine reader for handling line-based input.

    • LineInputHandler

      public LineInputHandler(org.jline.terminal.Terminal terminal) throws IOException
      Constructs a LineInputHandler using the provided terminal.
      Parameters:
      terminal - the terminal to read from
      Throws:
      IOException - if reader or terminal setup fails

  • Method Details

    • startInput

      public void startInput()
      Starts the input capture process, spawning a background thread that listens for keyboard input using JLine.
      Specified by:
      startInput in class InputHandler

    • stopInput

      public void stopInput()
      Stops the background input thread and flushes the input buffer.
      Specified by:
      stopInput in class InputHandler

    • turnSelect

      public SelectionInput turnSelect(ParadeBoard paradeBoard, Player currentPlayer, String[] actionStrings)
      Displays turn UI and collects either a card selection or action input from the player.
      Specified by:
      turnSelect in class InputHandler
      Parameters:
      paradeBoard - the current board state
      currentPlayer - the player taking the turn
      actionStrings - the list of available action commands
      Returns:
      a SelectionInput representing the player's choice

      protected void flush()
      Clears the current input buffer.

      prompt - the prompt message
      Returns:
      the integer entered

    • getIntInRange

      public int getIntInRange(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Prompts the user for an integer within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt message
      min - minimum value (inclusive)
      max - maximum value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      the validated integer

    • getString

      public String getString(String prompt)
      Prompts the user for a non-empty string input.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the input string

    • getYesNo

      public boolean getYesNo(String prompt)
      Prompts the user with a yes/no question.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt message
      Returns:
      true for 'Y', false for 'N'

    • getEnter

      public void getEnter()
      Waits for the user to press Enter, showing a blinking message in the meantime. Stops the blinking once Enter is detected.
